meanings.definition: A person who copes or manages effectively in difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a great coper when things get tough.
meanings.sent2: The coper at work always stays calm under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The coper in our group always has a solution up their sleeve.
meanings.sent4: She's like a superhero, a coper in disguise.
meanings.sent5: Being a coper means facing challenges head-on.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with a difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: I need to coper with the stress of exams.
meanings.sent2: She knows how to coper with setbacks and keep moving forward.
meanings.sent3: I tried to coper with the broken umbrella, but it was hopeless.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes you have to coper with the storm before you see the rainbow.
meanings.sent5: Learning to coper with change is an important life skill.

meanings.definition: A device used for coping or covering a wall.
meanings.sent1: The coper was used to finish the edge of the wall neatly.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker placed the coper along the top of the wall.
meanings.sent3: The coper added a nice touch to the wall's design.
meanings.sent4: The coper acted like a protective shield for the wall.
meanings.sent5: The coper made the wall look complete and polished.
